p.s: The speech given by Barack Obama on 7th November 2007 at Bettendorf, Iowa, is about the American Dream and the reasons to fight for it.
In the beginning Obama talks about the occasion and how near his homestate is.
Then he mentions the the problem of division according to the people in Washington.
In the following he compares these impressions to his own and points out how equal all people in their values and hopes are.
At this point he lists some important values.
Obama then goes on stating these values by telling how they led his grandfather to a better life.
He also illustrates how they helped his mother raising him under good conditions and how she passed on these values to him and his sister.
In the end he makes clear that these dreams led him to his life situation and that he knew even with only 12000$ a year that these values and these dreams are worth fighting for.
To sum up Obama points out how important the values of the American Dream are and that they are worth fighting for under any conditions.
